dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, have you seen the news about Kazakhstan's, uh, evacuation efforts? Pretty impressive, actually.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, have you seen the news about Kazakhstan's, uh, evacuation efforts? Pretty impressive, actually.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, yeah! I just saw a headline. They pulled a lot of people out, right? From, like, Israel and Iran?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, yeah! I just saw a headline. They pulled a lot of people out, right? From, like, Israel and Iran?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Kazakhstan™s Ministry of Foreign Affairs has revealed how many citizens were evacuated from Israel and Iran.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. The Ministry of Foreign Affairs just gave an update. Their spokesperson, Aibek Smadiyarov, said it was a large-scale operation under "extremely challenging conditions."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. The Ministry of Foreign Affairs just gave an update. Their spokesperson, Aibek Smadiyarov, said it was a large-scale operation under extremely challenging conditions.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: According to the ministry™s official spokesperson, Aibek Smadiyarov, Kazakhstan carried out a large-scale evacuation operation under extremely challenging conditions.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: "Extremely challenging"—that sounds like an understatement. How many did they manage to get out?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Extremely challenging-that sounds like an understatement. How many did they manage to get out?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Well, they evacuated 230 citizens from Iran and then another 66 from Israel. So, yeah, a decent number.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, they evacuated two hundred thirty citizens from Iran and then another sixty six from Israel. So, yeah, a decent number.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: As a result, 230 Kazakhstani citizens have been evacuated from Iran, and 66 from Israel, Smadiyarov said during a briefing.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Wow, 230 from Iran. That sounds, um, like a really complex route. Did they say how they did that?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wow, two hundred thirty from Iran. That sounds, um, like a really complex route. Did they say how they did that?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: They did! Smadiyarov mentioned the Iran evacuation was particularly complicated. People were transported through three countries—Azerbaijan, Turkmenistan, and Armenia.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: They did! Smadiyarov mentioned the Iran evacuation was particularly complicated. People were transported through three countries-Azerbaijan, Turkmenistan, and Armenia.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: According to Smadiyarov, the evacuation from Iran was more complicated: Kazakhstani citizens were transported through three countries " Azerbaijan, Turkmenistan, and Armenia.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [overlaps] Wow, three countries! And, like, winding mountain roads, right? I heard some were on buses for seventeen hours!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wow, three countries! And, like, winding mountain roads, right? I heard some were on buses for seventeen hours!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: It was especially difficult at night " along winding mountain roads. In some cases, people spent up to 17 hours on buses.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: That's right. And the borders were even closed at times, so they had to make, uh, diplomatic and human efforts to get them opened in the middle of the night.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's right. And the borders were even closed at times, so they had to make, uh, diplomatic and human efforts to get them opened in the middle of the night.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Borders were closed, so we had to make both diplomatic and human efforts to get them opened in the middle of the night so people could be let through.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: So, like, calling in favors, essentially? That's incredible. What about the Israel evacuees?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, like, calling in favors, essentially? That's incredible. What about the Israel evacuees?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: For Israel, it was a bit different. They went by bus to the Egyptian border, then flew from Cairo back to Shymkent.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For Israel, it was a bit different. They went by bus to the Egyptian border, then flew from Cairo back to Shymkent.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The evacuation from Israel involved transporting citizens by bus to the Egyptian border, after which they flew from Cairo to Shymkent and then traveled on to their respective regions.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Okay, so a different kind of logistical challenge there. Are all these people, like, safe now?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Okay, so a different kind of logistical challenge there. Are all these people, like, safe now?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yes, Smadiyarov confirmed all evacuees are safe. But, um, there are still some citizens remaining. About 50 in Iran—mostly diplomatic staff, and around 170 in Israel.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yes, Smadiyarov confirmed all evacuees are safe. But, um, there are still some citizens remaining. About fifty in Iran-mostly diplomatic staff, and around one hundred seventy in Israel.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: According to him, all evacuees are now safe. However, around 50 Kazakhstani citizens remain in Iran, and around 170 in Israel. Most of those in Iran are staff at Kazakhstan™s diplomatic missions.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: And the diplomatic staff, are they staying put? I mean, who helps if they leave?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And the diplomatic staff, are they staying put? I mean, who helps if they leave?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly! Smadiyarov addressed that directly. He said, "If we evacuate our diplomats, who will help the others?" So, they're staying.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly! Smadiyarov addressed that directly. He said, If we evacuate our diplomats, who will help the others? So, they're staying.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In response to the question of when the embassy will be evacuated " I™d like to say that if we evacuate our diplomats, who will help the others? That™s why our diplomats are staying and continuing their work, said the spokesperson.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: That makes sense. It really highlights the, uh, importance of international cooperation in these kinds of crises.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That makes sense. It really highlights the, uh, importance of international cooperation in these kinds of crises.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: For sure. They actually expressed gratitude to Israel, Iran, Armenia, Azerbaijan, and Turkmenistan for their assistance. It's, um, commendable work all around.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For sure. They actually expressed gratitude to Israel, Iran, Armenia, Azerbaijan, and Turkmenistan for their assistance. It's, um, commendable work all around.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: We are grateful to our colleagues in Israel, Iran, Armenia, Azerbaijan, and Turkmenistan for their assistance, Smadiyarov added.
